content:
Paul runs track, and he is training to improve his time in the $400$-meter race.  He does a time trial every $10$ days to monitor his improvement.  He's used the line $y = -1.5x + 120$ to model his $400$-meter time as a function of the number of days he has trained.   

**In the table below, calculate the residual value for each point.  Then plot the residuals on the graph below.**   

**Which of the following changes would improve the fit of the model?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

 | | | || | |
- | - | -
**Number of days** |$0$ | $10$| $20$ | $30$ | $40$|$50$
**Time (seconds)** | $120$ | $105$| $100$ | $90$| $80$|$75$|  
**Residual value** | [[☃ input-number 1]] | [[☃ input-number 2]]|  [[☃ input-number 3]]| [[☃ input-number 4]]|[[☃ input-number 5]]|[[☃ input-number 6]]
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

choices.content: Make the slope of the line steeper.
Make the slope of the line shallower.
Increase the y-intercept of the line.
Decrease the y-intercept of the line.
None of the above - the model is a good fit for the data.
